turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Torbay, Newfoundland and Labrador.
turn.1: When was the capture of St. John's from the French?
turn.2: The early history of the community was further highlighted by the landing of Colonel William Amherst and his troops in 1762 on their way to re-capturing the capital city of St. John's from the French.
turn.4: This event was officially recognized in 1978 when the first mayor of Torbay, William Manning unveiled a stone monument and plaque at the present day Veterans Memorial Park. "The following information is from: Statistics Canada" In the 2016 census the population was 7,899.
turn.6: In 2011 Torbay's population grew 17.8% from 2006 bringing the population to 7,397, making it one of the fastest growing communities in Newfoundland and Labrador.
turn.7: Are people still moving to the area?
turn.8: Population chart of the Town of Torbay: The town of Torbay is a bedroom community, with most of the workforce commuting to the nearby cities of St. John's and Mount Pearl.
turn.9: Is there a reason for this?
turn.10: No public transport links St. John's to its northern suburbs and exurbs, and all such commutes are done by car only.
turn.11: What types of jobs are available in the area?
turn.12: The town's economy is driven mostly by service industries that serve the residents such as a grocery store, convenience stores, doctors offices, hair salons, real-estate offices and restaurants among others.
